qas.question: How many casino closures took place in Atlantic City in 2014?
What was the name of the poorest performing casino in the city that ultimately closed in 2014?
What year did Trump Plaza originally open?
What was the name of Atlantic City's second-newest casino that ultimately closed in 2014?
What was the name of the first casino to close in 2014?

context: In the wake of the United States' economic downturn and the legalization of gambling in adjacent and nearby states (including Delaware, Maryland, New York, and Pennsylvania), <a0_0>four<a0_0/> casino closures took place in 2014: the <a4_0>Atlantic Club<a4_0/> on January 13; the Showboat on August 31; the <a3_0>Revel<a3_0/>, which was Atlantic City's second-newest casino, on September 2; and <a1_0>Trump Plaza<a1_0/>, which originally opened in <a2_0>1984<a2_0/>, and was the poorest performing casino in the city, on September 16.
